intro: Nuxia angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan nuxia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Nuxia angolensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
